project_name: UPM-HZ New Pipework for diesel tank

scope_of_work.problem: Following FM Global visit, it was found that the diesel tank pipework needs to be steel pipe in pipe
scope_of_work.scope:
Attend site for induction and sign relevant documents
3 days have been allowed for fabrication and on-site fitting
Fabricate 4 x 2 pipe in pipe for fuel line 
Fabricate 2 x 1 pipe in pipe for fuel return line 
Remove existing to suitable joint and fit new 
Items 1,2,3 & 4
2000L tank hire delivery, collection, pipework, fittings & labour/travel
scope_of_work.justification: The pipework needs to be steel pipe within pipe incase the pipe were to rupture as required to meet FM Global requirements
scope_of_work.non_approval_effect: It would fail to meet FM Global Insurance requirements

scope_of_work.notes:

scope_of_work.problem:
Distribution network operators are responsible for ensuring that the electrical characteristics at each generation customerâ€™s connection point to the electricity distribution system remains within statutory limits.

To enable distribution network operators to do this it is necessary for generation customers to have loss of mains protection
that is compliant with current statutory requirements.
scope_of_work.scope:
This is a 4-week programme of works to run alongside the separately funded HV Maintenance & associated HV Transformer maintenance. 3rd party specialist (Enerveo) to attend each week on days 2 and 3.

1. To supply a HV Siemens experienced protection engineer, to access each G59 HV CB protection device.
2. Removal of the vector shift setting on HVA2, HVB2, HVA3 and HVB3 protection mains incomer on each of these boards when released by the CBRE team.
3. Set the RoCoF to 500 milli seconds on HVA2, HVB2, HVA3 and HVB3 mains incomer protection relay one HV CB at time.
4. Using Calibrated G59 test equipment, verify test & record that the RoCoF trip time operates in the required time to meet the AcLomP
5. Provide detailed report and witness test sheet on completion for each Switchboard and HV G59 Protection device as each item is completed.
6. Provide Witness test sheet to the SSEN G59 point of contact, to CBRE Senior AP and deputy and CBRE the Site Manager as the work progresses - before each HV Switch board is restored and final parallel test.
7. Final witness report sheet to be issued as the work is completed and before the HV CB is restored and final parallel test.
scope_of_work.justification: Since 1 September 2022 it has been mandatory for G59 connected electricity generators to comply with Engineering Recommendation EREC G59/3-7, part of the Distribution Code. This requires that all applicable generation must have Loss of Mains (LoM) protection provided only by Rate of Change of Frequency (RoCoF) at a setting of 1 Hz/s with 500ms time delay.
scope_of_work.non_approval_effect: Failure to provide compliance information may result in de-energisation of the site power generation equipment.

scope_of_work.problem: DRUPS 2 is due maintenance to ensure the continued performance as per its design. The quality of fuel and fuel tank is unknown to a degree.
scope_of_work.scope:
- Remove all unrecoverable fuel from the tanks, using uplift tanker
- Clean the interior of the tank via manned entry tank cleaning
- Filter the recoverable fuel back into the tank and blend with Enzyme Energy
- Replace desiccant breather
scope_of_work.justification: This work is required to ensure the continued operation of DRUPS 2 to support critical IT load.
scope_of_work.non_approval_effect: DRUPS 2 may not operate and perform as designed and this could lead to total failure to back up critical IT load.

project_name: UPM-Loadbank for DRUPS Quarterly Run Jan 2024
status_history: here is the status change history of project in numbering order(1):work in progress by Jayme Feil

scope_of_work.notes:
1. Does not include any client contingency 
2. Assumes that CBRE hold the burden of the actual cost whether it is over or under the quotation value

scope_of_work.problem: DRUPS is due it's next quarterly load run at >35% load in January 2024. Current business load does not provide enough load so the hire of a 600kW load bank is required.
scope_of_work.scope: Hire and connection, disconnection of 600kW load bank with inline 1250A MCCB issue of PTWs/ICs Delivery of load bank
scope_of_work.justification: Maintain the DRUPS generator reliability and prevent wet stacking of generators due to low load conditions
scope_of_work.non_approval_effect: Increased risk of generator failure, reduction of DRUPS reliability

scope_of_work.problem: There are 2no water heaters on site and both have failed. The contractor has carried out investigation and reported that these unit are beyond economical repairs. This now means that there is no running domestic hot water on site.
scope_of_work.scope:
Disconnect electrical supplies to existing hot water heater. 
Drain down and remove existing gas fired water heater, cap of flue at high level. 
Install new 250 litre direct Gledhill unvented cylinder and connect up. 
Supply and install new electrical cables from existing supply to be run in from existing distribution 
board in plantroom which is approximately 20 meters away. Connect two 3KW immersions heaters. 
Test and commission system and leave in working order.
scope_of_work.justification: At the moment there is not any running domestic hot water. It is a statutory requirement  as set out in the governments  Workplace Regulations 1992
scope_of_work.non_approval_effect: At the moment there is not any running domestic hot water. It is a statutory requirement  as set out in the governments  Workplace Regulations 1992

project_name: UPM-Bulk Fuel Delivery for 100% Capacity at WWCK & UK 2023 Call Off
status_history: here is the status change history of project in numbering order(1):billing completed by Marge Hills (2):rejected by Marge Hills (3):offer submitted by Marge Hills

scope_of_work.notes:
1. Does not include any client contingency 
2. Assumes that CBRE hold the burden of the actual cost whether it is over or under the quotation value 
3. Maintenance contract budget variations as a result of project activity will be funded by client through the eBVO process
scope_of_work.problem:
Warwick:
The location currently has enough fuel to provide 48 hours however the bulk tank still has the capacity for an additional 20,000 litres. As we are approaching a difficult period it has been requested to look at filling the Bulk Tank on site to provide 72 hours of run time.


UK Sites for 2023 (Warwick & North Harbour,):
Both sites will require bulk fuel deliveries throughout 2023 to ensure there is sufficient runtime afforded for all generator and DRUPS employed at each location to support critical IT equipment as required.
scope_of_work.scope:
Warwick:
Specialist Supplier to provide 20,000 litres of Fuel to Kyndryl Warwick. Fuel to be transported to the location and pumped into the BST 2 Tank within the critical plant area.

UK Sites for 2023 (Warwick & North Harbour):
This LSE will be raised to allow sites to order bulk fuel deliveries when required.
scope_of_work.justification:
Warwick:
If there is a prolonged outage on site this fuel delivery will assist with supporting the locations critical infrastructure for a longer period, reducing risk of outages.

UK Sites for 2023 (Warwick & North Harbour):
This LSE will provide a more streamlined approach, will prevent hold ups when requiring additional fuel deliveries for the UK sites and will prevent additional administrative work.
scope_of_work.non_approval_effect:
Warwick:
There would be a reduced time on what the site is capable of supplying if we were to run on Generators for prolonged periods.

UK Sites for 2023 (Warwick & North Harbour):
If there is no fuel available systems will not continue to support critical IT equipment as required. If an LSQ is raised every time fuel is required, it will cause delays adding risk to the potential of power failure to critical equipment.
